intro: Limonium gomezi-jordanae, commonly known as the Canary Islands sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in dunes or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
